1331.content:
What was it about her? Was it her hair, her eyes, her shyness? Why was it that you liked her? For whatever reason you couldn't place why you liked Luna so much, you just did. You had met her at the begining of the school year during your free period, at first she was just the girl that sat by herself and didn't talk to anyone but when you looked at her really looked at her you got this odd feeling. It was hard to explain, just something inside you that told you 'hey, we gotta know everything about that girl'. So it was that one fateful day you walked over to her and said hi, catching her by surprise but she said hi back. After that, well wow we're you two together. Texting after school, following each other in the hallways between classes, passing notes all that jazz. Yet you guys weren't together, mainly because you were too shy to ask and you knew Luna had eyes for Sly, who you were pretty sure really had the hots for Patty but just couldn't tell Luna that. You try flirting with her, nothing super flirty but enough for her to know you had the hots for her a little bit. Then now, on your birthday, you wake up to another day of school. 1551.content:
You were one if the lucky few able to enter the spirit world, and had chosen to do so, having not had the oppurtunity in some time. You'd spent some time admiring the vast forests and architecture before entering a small inn for a quick drink. There you were, waiting to be served, when the door opened, and she walked in.
She was a slim woman, timid in nature, with long, flowing white hair yet young. She had clear blue eyes and a modest dress, covering her figure. You licked your lips as she passed and watched as she approached your friend, the owner.
"Could I have a glass of water please?"
"Certainly Kisara. Busy day?"
"A bit of travelling, yes."
"Is your friend too busy to give you a lift?"
"Oh no, I insisted on walking. This is a lovely place."
"That it is. Here you go."
The inn was in reality a small hut where your friend ran his own business. As such, he had limited seats and you didn't need much luck for Kisara to sit next to you.
To be honest, you didn't need any luck. Your friend knew what your "habits" were and winked at you when she wasn't looking. You smiled back and struck up a casual conversation.

You wondered if she was already interested in you - she had finished her drink a while ago, yet had stayed to listen to your tall tales of adventures in both worlds, laughing and gasping as if on cue. You offered to buy her a drink and she accepted ("Just some juice please"). When you went up to the owner you asked him to get her a...

15512.content:
"Hey Zaloog, can I have the usual for the lady please?" You asked loudly. He creased at the code word you'd already established, disappeared for a moment, then reappeared with a particular beverage. You winked and accepted a similarly flavoured, non-alcoholic drink for yourself (no use in YOU being woozy). You returned, handed Kisara her flask and sat down next to her. She took a tentative sniff of her glass, then a sip.
"I've never tasted this before. What's in it?"
"It's a mix of the various fruits that grow in this place." Which was, in fact, true. Mostly.
"The flavours are just, dancing, on my tongue." She took a larger sip with a look of contentment on her face. You smiled knowingly at her as you drank your own drink.
Upon telling her that you and Zaloog were old friends, and that he'd serve the two of you as much as you wanted, you were pleased to see two more tankards join the first. Kisara leaned back afterwards, her face flushed and a wide smile resting on it.
You figured it was time to act. " You're a very lovely woman Kisara. You know that?"
"That's sweet of you to say..."
"You're very beautiful."
"Thank you."
"And I'd like to see more of you."
For a frightening moment, she seemed to sober up, but quickly regained her absent-mindedness.
"Before you go any further, there's someone you should meet..."
"Wh-who?" Uh oh. Was she already taken?
"Out there." She nodded towards the window. You turned and jumped to see a giant blue eye staring back at you. The sound of Kisara's loud laughter (unbefitting a woman with her wardrobe) brought you back to your senses.
"O-of course. Blue-Eyes."
The White Dragon took flight and faded away as you caught your breath.
"So that was your friend?"
She nodded. "Just trying to have some fun..." She placed her head on your shoulder. "So. See more of me? When do you want to meet?"
Her naivety surprised you. "I have a house near here," you began "if it wasn't too much trouble, could you grace me with your presence?"
"Very well."
Upon entering your home away from home you bolted the door, you turned to see Kisara sitting on the side of your bed, straightening her dress. She looked up at you questioningly.
